channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Experts Question Denmark’s Vaccine Program as a Model for the U.S.
item.description: The United States is expected to adopt the vaccine schedule used by Denmark, a much smaller country with universal health care.

item.title: Parts of New York and New England Brace for Ice Storm
item.description: Several states were under weather warnings or advisories early Monday. The same winter storm battered the Midwest over the weekend.

item.title: Electric vehicles had a bumpy road in 2025 — and one pleasant surprise
item.description: A suite of pro-EV federal policies have been reversed. Well-known vehicles have been discontinued. Sales plummeted. But interest is holding steady.

item.title: 'Raising questions' isn't enough. The best films of the year took a stance
item.description: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.

item.title: For Zelensky, Just Keeping Trump Talking About Ukraine Peace Deal Counts as a Win
item.description: Though discussions produced little tangible progress, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at least avoided the type of setbacks that have blighted...

item.title: Inside Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Break With Trump and MAGA
item.description: How the Georgia congresswoman went from the president’s loudest cheerleader to his loudest Republican critic.

item.title: Why do so many people ring in the new year on Jan. 1?
item.description: Much of the world follows the Gregorian calendar, named after Pope Gregory XIII, who put the finishing touches on a Roman system that integrated ideas...

item.title: Five Takeaways From the New York Times Profile of Marjorie Taylor Greene
item.description: The congresswoman discussed her break with President Trump and her journey from MAGA zealot to political isolation.

item.title: A 'very aesthetic person,' President Trump says being a builder is his second job
item.description: President Trump was a builder before he took office, but he has continued it as a hobby in the White House.

item.title: Teens are having disturbing interactions with chatbots. Here's how to lower the risks

item.title: Claire Brosseau Wants to Die. Will Canada Let Her?

item.title: The World Wants More Ube. Philippine Farmers Are Struggling to Keep Up.
item.description: Soaring demand and extreme weather worsened by climate change have wiped out harvests of the popular purple yam.
